title: Advanced JavaScript: Async/Await Tutorial
description: Learn how to use async/await in JavaScript for handling asynchronous operations. Covers promises, error handling, and real-world examples.

annotations.notes: Introduces the concept of Promises and their three states: pending, fulfilled, and rejected. Shows basic Promise creation with resolve and reject.
Demonstrates using .then() and .catch() methods to handle promise resolution and errors. Shows chaining multiple promises together.
Explains the async keyword and how it makes a function return a Promise. Shows how await pauses execution until the Promise resolves.
Demonstrates error handling with try/catch blocks in async functions. Shows best practices for handling multiple async operations.
Shows parallel execution using Promise.all() vs sequential await calls. Discusses performance implications of each approach.
Demonstrates real-world examples: fetching data from APIs, file operations, and database queries using async/await patterns.

title: React Hooks Explained: useState and useEffect
description: Complete guide to React Hooks focusing on useState and useEffect. Learn how to manage state and side effects in functional components.

annotations.notes: Introduces useState hook and its syntax. Shows how to declare state variables and update them. Compares with class component state.
Demonstrates multiple state variables, object state, and array state. Shows functional updates for state that depends on previous state.

queries.query_text: What is useEffect and when to use it?

annotations.notes: Explains useEffect for side effects. Shows the dependency array and how it controls when effects run. Covers cleanup functions.
Demonstrates common use cases: data fetching, subscriptions, DOM manipulation. Shows best practices for avoiding infinite loops.

title: Database Design Fundamentals
description: Learn the fundamentals of relational database design including normalization, relationships, and indexing strategies.

annotations.notes: Introduces the concept of normalization and why it's important. Explains first normal form (1NF) with examples of atomic values and eliminating repeating groups.
Covers second normal form (2NF) and partial dependencies. Shows how to identify and remove partial dependencies with practical examples.
Explains third normal form (3NF) and transitive dependencies. Demonstrates the process of decomposing tables to achieve 3NF.

queries.query_text: How do you design table relationships?

annotations.notes: Introduces one-to-many relationships with foreign keys. Shows examples using customers and orders tables.
Explains many-to-many relationships and junction tables. Demonstrates with students and courses example.

queries.query_text: What are database indexes and when to use them?

annotations.notes: Explains what indexes are and how they speed up queries. Discusses B-tree indexes and their structure. Shows query performance comparison with and without indexes.
